thread.title: Life | First born children are more intelligent than their younger siblings
thread.title_full: Life | First born children are more intelligent than their younger siblings - entertainment.ie

author: Jason Brennan
title: Life | First born children are more intelligent than their younger siblings
text:
What does dumb stupid science know anyway, couldn't even make us more smarter.
So according to research published in the Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences, first born children are given the advantage of an IQ boost, as they are responsible for teaching their younger siblings as they grow. It's either that, or it has something to do with being given more attention in the early years, so they're getting taught better.
See, they're not even sure about it themselves, so how can we trust it. Best just forget about it all now.
If you haven't already figured it out, just about everyone in the office is the youngest in their family, so forgive our bias.
The research, which was carried out by Germans scientists, studied the IQ levels of over 20,000 people from Germany, the US, and the UK, eventually finding a drop off of about 1.5 IQ points per child when it came to birth order.
Still laughing, oldest siblings? Well have some of this. The research also says that older siblings are more likely to be overweight, but we won't get into statistics because that's just. Lets just say it's a lot more than 1.5 points.
..
..
It's 29%!!
Via Irish Independent and Metro
